result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Russell L Collins

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Russell L Collins in court, in custody.  
Attorney Daniel Mcmurray in court for Russell L Collins.  
Attorney Dax Odom appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Status Conference.
Defendant in custody on a new  pending felony Case. 
Court will address the State's Motion to join 21CM1225 with case 2cf2123 at the next proceedings.
Court vacated 10-31-2022 Jury trial and scheduled case for a status.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Status conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADJOURNED OFF THE RECORD. 
Case calendared for a status conference tagging along with case 21CF2123. 
This court is in trial on a different matter and ordered scheduled hearing adjourned
New date confirmed with the parties.
Case remains calendared in Branch 19.
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Russell L Collins in court with attorney Daniel Mcmurray.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a calendar call. Defendant's other pending felony case, 2021CF2123, is going to trial. Case will be following along with pending felony case. Case adjourned to Branch 45. 
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Daniel Mcmurray in court.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.  Defense requested Plea/Sentencing stay in Branch 45; Court denied request but would take future Spin.  Court ordered case adjourned for Calendar Call.  Calendar call scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

22RM026689  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05/19/2022 sa

Defendant Russell L Collins in court with attorney Daniel Mcmurray.  Kelly Hedge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant waived his right to a speedy trial.  Cases are scheduled in br 45 for plea and sentencing.  mn  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Defendant Russell L Collins in court by video with Attorney Daniel Mcmurray who appears in person. Russell Collins in custody. John Daniel Flynn appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee County Deputy J. Blanchar. Court took Judical Notice 21CF2123.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Court orders previous conditions to remain in full force and effect.

Defendant Russell L Collins in court, via zoom, with attorney Daniel Mcmurray.  Defendant Russell L Collins in custody.  Kelly Hedge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Initial Appearance. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2 and 3.

Defendant Russell L Collins in court, via zoom, with attorney Daniel Mcmurray.  Defendant Russell L Collins in custody.  Kelly Hedge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Return on Doctors Report. Parties do not contest the report.  Court finds the defendant is competent to proceed and reinstates the proceedings.  Defense requests Preliminary Hearing date.  Case adjourned to Prelim Court.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
At the request of defense counsel, this matter is adjourned for Review Hearing on 5/12/22 at 1:30 in Br  45.  State agreed to date.  mn
COLLINS REPORT, Filed.
Order of Commitment for Treatment, signed and filed.

Defendant Russell L Collins in court with attorney Daniel Mcmurray.  Defendant Russell L Collins in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Kelly Hedge.    The court finds the defendant not competent to proceed but likely to become competent within the statutory time period.  if provided with appropriate treatment, is likely to become competent within 12 months or within the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less. 
The court orders the proceedings suspended and committed the defendant to the Department of Health Services for an indeterminate term not to exceed 12 months, or the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less.  Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) signed and filed.
Case adjourned for review hearing  in Branch 45.   mn
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Discharge Report 3-11-2022
received and filed.
Order Appointing Counsel, filed.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Daniel Mcmurray in court, appearing as a friend of the court, defendant Russell L Collins not in court, in custody.  Kelly Hedge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties appear in person.
Defendant has three other pending cases before Branch 45.
Court advises parties that the doctor's report has not been completed.
Court orders case adjourned for return of doctor's report in Branch 45.  Hearing may be held via Zoom video.

Clerk:  jms
COLLINS LETTER, Filed.
Forensic evaluation ordered.  INITIAL APPEARANCE NOT HELD.  Trial court to address INITIAL APPEARANCE on next court date.

Defendant Russell L Collins in court with attorney Rosemary Cuevas.  Defendant Russell L Collins in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Russell L Collins appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for February 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
